content: a very pretty shawl design with a lovely drape using approx 400m of fingering weight yarn one beautiful skein of yarn is all that is needed to show off this asymmetrical shawl in an easy 4-row repeat pattern made using basic crochet stitches that combine to create an interesting pattern that is relaxing and quick to crochet **materials** litlg life in the long grass 4 ply/fine sock - 75% sw merino /25% nylon - 100g/435m colour - saturn 4mm crochet hook you can use approx 400m of any fingering weight yarn or yarn weight of your choice and matching hook **measurements** shawl pictured measures 68in 173cm on the longest length and 17in 43cm depth after blocking you can find a free version on my blog
